Claim: Former NYC Mayor Rudolph Giuliani said he “bought $2M in shares of Novartis, a primary supplier of hydroxychloroquine” in early February.
Explaination: While Novartis paid Giuliani a speaker’s fee in 2006, there is no publicly available evidence that he currently has a financial stake in the company. He has denied having one in press reports.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Former NYC Mayor Rudolph Giuliani said he “bought $2M in shares of Novartis, a primary supplier of hydroxychloroquine” in early February.

Explanation:While Novartis paid Giuliani a speaker’s fee in 2006, there is no publicly available evidence that he currently has a financial stake in the company. He has denied having one in press reports.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/apr/09/tweets/fact-checking-rudy-giulianis-ties-hydroxychloroqui/

Claim: Numerous conspiracy theories shared on and off social media claim that 5G mobile networks are the cause of the novel coronavirus pandemic.
Explaination: This is false; experts told AFP that 5G is based on radio frequency and that this does not create viruses.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Numerous conspiracy theories shared on and off social media claim that 5G mobile networks are the cause of the novel coronavirus pandemic.

Explanation:This is false; experts told AFP that 5G is based on radio frequency and that this does not create viruses.

https://factcheck.afp.com/experts-dismiss-claims-5g-wireless-technology-created-novel-coronavirus

Claim: A photo showing Uganda’s first case of COVID-19.
Explaination: The photo of a man wearing a mask does not show Uganda's first COVID-19 case, but was actually taken at the John F Kennedy International Airport in February 2020.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A photo showing Uganda’s first case of COVID-19.

Explanation:The photo of a man wearing a mask does not show Uganda's first COVID-19 case, but was actually taken at the John F Kennedy International Airport in February 2020.

https://pesacheck.org/false-this-man-wearing-a-face-mask-is-not-ugandas-first-confirmed-covid-19-case-1b1e29fc40c9?source=rss----ab41f21aa9a9---4

Claim: Punjab authorities have advised citizens not to eat goat meat for 60 days.
Explaination: China coronavirus: Pakistani officials deny they issued warning over dangers of eating goat meat.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Punjab authorities have advised citizens not to eat goat meat for 60 days.

Explanation:China coronavirus: Pakistani officials deny they issued warning over dangers of eating goat meat.

http://u.afp.com/PakistanGoats

Claim: Drinking tea can help cure COVID-19.
Explaination: There is no evidence that drinking tea can help mitigate the effects of the coronavirus.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Drinking tea can help cure COVID-19.

Explanation:There is no evidence that drinking tea can help mitigate the effects of the coronavirus.

https://www.thejournal.ie/debunked-drinking-tea-covid-19-coronavirus-5057320-Mar2020/

Claim: A photo shows people infected with coronavirus  lying on the sidewalk in China.
Explaination: It was an artistic performance in germany in 2014.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A photo shows people infected with coronavirus lying on the sidewalk in China.

Explanation:It was an artistic performance in germany in 2014.

https://factcheck.afp.com/2014-photo-people-participating-art-project-frankfurt-germany

Claim: Compounds in tea can help cure COVID-19.
Explaination: Methylxanthine, theobromine and theophylline, which are found in tea, are good for health and airway management, but cannot cure COVID-19.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Compounds in tea can help cure COVID-19.

Explanation:Methylxanthine, theobromine and theophylline, which are found in tea, are good for health and airway management, but cannot cure COVID-19.

https://pesacheck.org/false-this-post-claiming-that-compounds-found-in-tea-can-cure-covid-19-is-a-hoax-642990a55009?source=rss----ab41f21aa9a9---4

Claim: The novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) “will not last long” in the Philippines because of its warm climate.
Explaination: The World Health Organization (WHO) has not said that temperature affects the spread of 2019-nCoV and they don't recommend exposure to heat as protection or a treatment for the virus.
Label: False
html:
Claim: The novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) “will not last long” in the Philippines because of its warm climate.

Explanation:The World Health Organization (WHO) has not said that temperature affects the spread of 2019-nCoV and they don't recommend exposure to heat as protection or a treatment for the virus.

https://www.rappler.com/newsbreak/fact-check/250679-coronavirus-eliminated-high-temperatures

Claim: Bloggers say Nancy Pelosi delayed coronavirus funding so “Dems could campaign on it.”
Explaination: President Donald Trump signed an $8.3 billion emergency spending bill to address the coronavirus on March 6. There is no evidence House Speaker Nancy Pelosi delayed the bill solely to run political ads.
Label: Mostly false
html:
Claim: Bloggers say Nancy Pelosi delayed coronavirus funding so “Dems could campaign on it.”

Explanation:President Donald Trump signed an $8.3 billion emergency spending bill to address the coronavirus on March 6. There is no evidence House Speaker Nancy Pelosi delayed the bill solely to run political ads.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/10/blog-posting/fact-checking-claims-pelosi-held-coronavirus-aid/

Claim: Leaving half an onion in your home will “catch” the coronavirus and prevent people from getting it.
Explaination: Onions are not a way to prevent the coronavirus from entering your home. The claim that onions can help prevent illness has been around since the 1930s.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Leaving half an onion in your home will “catch” the coronavirus and prevent people from getting it.

Explanation:Onions are not a way to prevent the coronavirus from entering your home. The claim that onions can help prevent illness has been around since the 1930s.

https://jrnl.ie/5061663

Claim: Coronavirus cases linked to 5G rollout.
Explaination: Overlaps in the map between 5G and cases can be explained by population density.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Coronavirus cases linked to 5G rollout.

Explanation:Overlaps in the map between 5G and cases can be explained by population density.

https://hoax-alert.leadstories.com/3472036-fact-check-coronavirus-cases-in-us-not-linked-to-5g-rollout.html

Claim: Costco recalls toilet paper because it’s infected with the coronavirus.
Explaination: The notice is not authentic, according to a statement from the wholesaler, and the brand of bath tissue in question is not listed on official recall websites.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Costco recalls toilet paper because it’s infected with the coronavirus.

Explanation:The notice is not authentic, according to a statement from the wholesaler, and the brand of bath tissue in question is not listed on official recall websites.

https://factcheck.afp.com/costco-not-recalling-bath-tissue-due-novel-coronavirus-contamination?fbclid=IwAR1TBUpUk_Y_6RW_VqxxUBmU-bhJ7iNrUSmYHmoTnH0Fb9_-hKJiNzaLrfY

Claim: A video shows a bat-infested roof in Hubei, China, claiming to be the source of the new coronavirus.
Explaination: This video dates back to 2011, which is almost 9 years ago. This video is from Miami, Florida, USA and has nothing to do with Novel coronavirus and China.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A video shows a bat-infested roof in Hubei, China, claiming to be the source of the new coronavirus.

Explanation:This video dates back to 2011, which is almost 9 years ago. This video is from Miami, Florida, USA and has nothing to do with Novel coronavirus and China.

https://english.factcrescendo.com/chinas-source-for-coronavirus/

Claim: Chennai municipal corporation has asked all vegetable and fruit markets to shut down.
Explaination: No such order was issued. All vegetable and fruit markets are open in Chennai.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Chennai municipal corporation has asked all vegetable and fruit markets to shut down.

Explanation:No such order was issued. All vegetable and fruit markets are open in Chennai.

https://www.indiatoday.in/fact-check/story/fact-check-viral-message-of-chennai-veggies-markets-shutting-due-to-coronavirus-is-a-hoax-1657146-2020-03-18

Claim: Dr. Naresh Trehan has said that the Indian government is going to declare a national emergency.
Explaination: This is a hoax. Dr Trehan's office has not issued any such message.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Dr. Naresh Trehan has said that the Indian government is going to declare a national emergency.

Explanation:This is a hoax. Dr Trehan's office has not issued any such message.

https://www.indiatoday.in/fact-check/story/fact-check-no-dr-trehan-did-not-say-indian-govt-will-declare-national-emergency-1658838-2020-03-23

Claim: Initial lack of evidence for human-to-human COVID-19 transmission unusual.
Explaination: We lined up the tweets from WHO and showed there was a progression from not know to the transmission being human-to-human
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: Initial lack of evidence for human-to-human COVID-19 transmission unusual.

Explanation:We lined up the tweets from WHO and showed there was a progression from not know to the transmission being human-to-human

https://hoax-alert.leadstories.com/3472050-fact-check-initial-lack-of-evidence-for-human-to-human-COVID-2019-transmission-not-unusual.html

Claim: Whether countries with high rates of childhood vaccines were hit hardest by coronavirus.
Explaination: Some of the countries with the lowest spread of the virus are those that have higher vaccination rates than the United States.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Whether countries with high rates of childhood vaccines were hit hardest by coronavirus.

Explanation:Some of the countries with the lowest spread of the virus are those that have higher vaccination rates than the United States.

https://leadstories.com/hoax-alert/2020/03/fact-check-countries-with-high-rates-of-childhood-vaccinations-are-not-hardest-hit-with-coronavirus.html
ann03_remarks: could be social alarm and also conspiracy vs vaccines

Claim: A video says the Vatican confirmed Pope Francis and two aides tested positive for coronavirus.
Explaination: The Vatican has denied the stories, saying the pope has a “slight illness.”
Label: Pants on Fire!
html:
Claim: A video says the Vatican confirmed Pope Francis and two aides tested positive for coronavirus.

Explanation:The Vatican has denied the stories, saying the pope has a “slight illness.”

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/02/youtube-videos/false-video-says-pope-francis-has-coronavirus/
ann03_remarks: I put 6 because religion is not public authority (for French republicans) ;-)

Claim: Whether coronavirus began with man having sex with a bat.
Explaination: This came from a clear satire website as fake.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Whether coronavirus began with man having sex with a bat.

Explanation:This came from a clear satire website as fake.

https://leadstories.com/hoax-alert/2020/03/Fact-Check-Coronavirus-'Patient-Zero'-Is-NOT-A-Man-Who-Had-Sex-With-A-Bat.html

Claim: A video has been viewed tens of thousands of times in multiple Facebook, YouTube and Twitter posts alongside a claim it shows the Islamic call to prayer being heard in Spain during the COVID-19 epidemic for the first time in 500 years.
Explaination: The claim is false; the video was filmed in Azerbaijan in November 2019, before the COVID-19 pandemic; there has been no ban on the Islamic call to prayer in Spain in recent times.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A video has been viewed tens of thousands of times in multiple Facebook, YouTube and Twitter posts alongside a claim it shows the Islamic call to prayer being heard in Spain during the COVID-19 epidemic for the first time in 500 years.

Explanation:The claim is false; the video was filmed in Azerbaijan in November 2019, before the COVID-19 pandemic; there has been no ban on the Islamic call to prayer in Spain in recent times.

https://factcheck.afp.com/video-was-filmed-azerbaijan-november-2019

Claim: The WHO declared COVID-19 is the abbreviation for China Outbreak Virus in December 2019.
Explaination: WHO declared the official name of coronavirus as COVID-19, which stands for coronavirus Disease. It has been falsely claimed to be an abbreviation for China Outbreak Virus In December 19.
Label: False
html:
Claim: The WHO declared COVID-19 is the abbreviation for China Outbreak Virus in December 2019.

Explanation:WHO declared the official name of coronavirus as COVID-19, which stands for coronavirus Disease. It has been falsely claimed to be an abbreviation for China Outbreak Virus In December 19.

https://english.factcrescendo.com/2020/02/14/who-declared-coronavirus-as-covid-19-which-stands-for-corona-virus-disease/

Claim: Post says Harvard scientists say the coronavirus is “spreading so fast that it will infect 70% of humanity this year.”
Explaination: An epidemiologist at Harvard University projects 40%-70% of adults could catch coronavirus in the coming year.
Label: HALF TRUE
html:
Claim: Post says Harvard scientists say the coronavirus is “spreading so fast that it will infect 70% of humanity this year.”

Explanation:An epidemiologist at Harvard University projects 40%-70% of adults could catch coronavirus in the coming year.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/11/viral-image/epidemiologist-projects-40-70-adults-could-catch-c/

Claim: 31 coronavirus patients have recovered in Ghana.
Explaination: The Ghana Health Service says only 3 coronavirus patients in Ghana have recovered.
Label: False
html:
Claim: 31 coronavirus patients have recovered in Ghana.

Explanation:The Ghana Health Service says only 3 coronavirus patients in Ghana have recovered.

https://ghanafact.com/false-31-coronavirus-patients-recover-in-ghana/

Claim: Barack Obama warned Africans against vaccines from America and Europe.
Explaination: Mr Obama’s office says the former president has not made any statements on coronavirus vaccines. Also, there is no factual evidence of former US President Obama cautioning Africans to resist the testing of vaccines. Aside from viral social media messages, no reputable media outlet, both international and national, have reported the claim.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Barack Obama warned Africans against vaccines from America and Europe.

Explanation:Mr Obama’s office says the former president has not made any statements on coronavirus vaccines. Also, there is no factual evidence of former US President Obama cautioning Africans to resist the testing of vaccines. Aside from viral social media messages, no reputable media outlet, both international and national, have reported the claim.

https://ghana.dubawa.org/did-barack-obama-wade-into-the-vaccine-debate/

Claim: President Donald Trump in the next 48 to 72 hours will impose a nationwide “mandatory quarantine.”
Explaination: The White House’s National Security Council addressed the claim in a statement on Twitter, saying: “Text message rumors of a national #quarantine are FAKE. There is no national lockdown.”
Label: False
html:
Claim: President Donald Trump in the next 48 to 72 hours will impose a nationwide “mandatory quarantine.”

Explanation:The White House’s National Security Council addressed the claim in a statement on Twitter, saying: “Text message rumors of a national #quarantine are FAKE. There is no national lockdown.”

https://www.factcheck.org/2020/03/false-claims-of-nationwide-lockdown-for-covid-19/
